details.description:
AffinityX is looking for a Quality Assurance Analyst who has an eye for detail and a flair for Quality Control and Quality Assurance related activities. The job holder will be responsible for reviewing the Ads assigned to him by his supervisor. As a Quality Assurance Analyst, the job holder will be responsible for identifying the errors and tagging the errors as per the quality form and guidelines set. The position requires to work closely with the Quality Team leader for all operation and administrative tasks.


Responsibilities:

  • To follow the Quality procedure, guidelines, and work instructions shared by the management
  • To identify errors and tag the errors as per the quality checklist
  • To complete the quality checks assigned to him/her and meet the productivity levels
  • To focus on error tagging % and external quality targets
  • To function as a subject matter expert in the process.
  • To verify all ads assigned for analysis and correctly mark them on the form.
  • To identify errors and tag the errors as per the bifurcation list given from time to time
  • To achieve a targeted Error tagging percentage
  • To focus on error tagging accuracy
  • To work as a production and designer fix the number of ads per month or fixed number of hours per month. This will help the position holder to keep in touch with the process and its requirements.
  • To keep himself/herself updated on all new process updates, process flow and information
  • Ensure the design /built as per the input/instructions provided by the client
  • Review the design, spelling, grammar, font, and text alignment of the creative design built by the designers.
  • To be responsible for a set of designers and provide one on one feedback to the designers assigned to him/her.
  • Assist the Quality Assurance Team Lead in resolving inspection, audit, or revision evaluation disputes, maintaining quality records, performing root cause analysis, and identifying and implementing corrective and preventive actions to improve performance
  • Reports & Compliance:
  • Capture the errors tagged correctly and document the same
  • Fill all required forms on AIMS or any other platforms instructed by your supervisor
  • Provide timely and qualitative reports to the supervisor.
  • Ensure compliance as required by AffinityX.
  • Ensure compliance to Organisational policies like code of conduct, IT policy, etc.


Requirements:

  • Graduate, 1-2 years working experience. Preferable in Print, Online or Branding and promotional team
  • Should have knowledge of Designing in Print, Online or Branding and promotional products
  • If the candidate is a fresher - He should be a quick learner and have creative exposure
  • Should have flair for Design and Creative jobs
  • Working knowledge of MS Office (esp. MS Excel) suite of products skills
  • Attention to detail. The ability to recognize parts of a product or procedure to verify the correctness or identify errors. As a Quality Assurance Analyst, the job holder is required to ensure all errors are captured, tagged, and documented.
  • Data gathering, recording, and analysis. The job holder will be involved in evaluating the revision received. We are looking for the ability to seek, gather, and form meaning from data from various sources to provide context or resolution.
  • Communication Skills. To effectively communicate in English for all business purposes. This includes communication to internal and external stakeholders. Should have strong verbal and written skills
  • System Knowledge. Sound knowledge of Adwatch, Adobe, Designer tools, In Design, and quickly learn In-house tools like AIMS and other quality control tools. Ability to operate computer, Laptop, Knowledge or applications used and other Quality monitoring tools.
  • Time Management. Should be a good organiser and Time management. Should be able to use discretion to prioritize tasks by using fair judgment.
  • Decision Making & Problem solving: Ability to make fair and consistent judgments and decisions. Ability to solve problems and offer suggestions.
  • Coaching & MentoringShould be able to give feedback to designers and monitor progress.
details.title: Quality Assurance

Our fast-moving development team evaluates and implements technologies and ideas and incubates them into products and solutions for internal teams. We're dedicated to agile methodology. employer.company_tagline: Work together. from anywhere
employer.instahyre_note: RingCentral is a global provider of cloud-based unified communications and collaboration products and solutions for enterprises allowing its members to be connected. Customers include Lyft, Coursera, etc.

details.description:
As a member of the Ring Central Ring CX Engineering team, you'll tackle complex, mission-critical problems and build the platform that's changing the way the world communicates. RingCentral RingCX is a CCaaS solution that serves businesses large and small, providing highly reliable uptime, scalability and flexibility to support any business need or workflow.


We are looking for a Software Development Engineer who will work and collaborate on teams and projects with the responsibility for designing and delivering secure, distributed, scalable, and fault-tolerant services, end-user applications, and APIs. In this role, you will have an opportunity to use your engineering expertise & leadership in the delivery of cloud-hosted (AWS, Azure) SaaS systems. You will work on complex, event-driven services adhering to agile engineering practices and processes with a strong focus on automation. Driving improvement in all aspects of your work will be part of your day-to-day with the RingCX team. You should be motivated, organized, excited about technology and SaaS products, a thorough critical thinker, and relentless when it comes to code quality, scalability, latency, and platform stability. Our culture is motivational, constructive, and positive. We value teamwork, camaraderie, and collaboration. If you're up for a fun challenge, we want to hear from you!


Responsibilities:

  • Work with architects and business owners on clarifying requirements, providing feedback, offering technical solutions, and providing implementation estimates.
  • Plan and coordinate work between cross-functional and geographically distributed teams to ensure timely implementation and delivery to the production environment
  • Be a technical leader and a go-to person for your area, and a sounding board for other peers in other areas and teams.
  • Coach junior team members, work across engineering teams, provide technical leadership and make it happen.
  • Work in close communication with the RingCX SRE team on the performance and quality of the RingCX services
  • Review requirements and translate them into technical implementation - focusing on responding with output that delivers on the business value.
  • Follow RingCentral internal coding style and principle to design and implement business systems based on requirements
  • Promote and contribute to all aspects of employing automation, across all test layers and development pipelines. (from unit through functional up to and including end-to-end/system/solution test).
  • Seek to maximize test coverage across all test layers by contributing to test case backlog and implementation using a wide variety of test and test automation frameworks
  • Push boundaries for continual quality and automation on code base and product
  • Build/Create modern backend services and APIs to operate in real-time/near real-time system/domain
  • Perform design, architecture, and code reviews for your RingCX team & other developers and continuously look for opportunities to improve and optimize code quality
  • Effectively communicate and collaborate on design and technology with management and other engineering teams
  • Push for continual improvements of engineering processes and tools


Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field or equivalent, is required
  • 8+ years in an engineering software development role building backend services and APIs having experience with SaaS, event driven, highly available, scalable, resilient systems delivering enterprise-grade commercial cloud services.
  • Strong problem solving skills, can-do attitude with the ability to analyze, troubleshoot, and solve a wide range of technical problems
  • Experienced with agile-type rapid development, CI/CD
  • Great communication skills; ability to effectively present ideas and thoughts
  • Willingness to take ownership of the tasks and to achieve targets with minimum supervision
  • Java or having programming language skills suitable for media server development (Rust, C++ etc) SIP, k8s, Asterisk
  • Experience with ReST, gRPC, Kafka, K8s, Docker, Spring Boot, Prometheus, Grafana, AWS & Azure services.
  • Experience with event-driven design, distributed systems, containerization & multi-threaded programming
  • Nice to have: SIP Experience - the more the better, as a client (RFC3261 MSML), as a server (RFC3261), as a B2BUA, 3pcc, Media Experience - the more the better, RTP/RTCP, Codecs (PCM and G. 711), Jitter buffer, PLC (G. 711), Timing (clock)
  • Audio real-time processing (mixing)
  • Audio post-processing (audio file (PCM WAV) to/from raw audio streams (G. 711))
  • Experience with MySQL/Aurora, MongoDB, DynamoDB, CouchBase DB, S3/Athena
  • Experience with message bus and streaming technologies (Kafka, ActiveMQ)
  • Experience with Telecoms and VoIP is a plus
  • Experience building real-time/near real-time applications is a plus
  • Demonstrated experience deploying applications and API services of Enterprise grade that scale to thousands of users

details.description:
This role will contribute to the design and maintenance of the IT General Computing Control (ITGCC) SOX program at BMS Hyderabad. This position is critical in supporting the IT governance processes established to manage IT risk and, ensure critical controls are implemented and operating as expected. Our purpose is to monitor compliance with evolving global GxP and SOX regulatory expectations through CSV and compliance monitoring. Our focus areas include SDLC, IT Service Management processes, Validation Services, Audit, and CAPAs.


At BMS, digital innovation and Information Technology are central to our vision of transforming patients' lives through science. To accelerate our ability to serve patients around the world, we must unleash the power of technology. We are committed to being at the forefront of transforming the way medicine is made and delivered by harnessing the power of computer and data science, artificial intelligence, and other technologies to promote scientific discovery, faster decision-making, and enhanced patient care.


Responsibilities:

  • Perform IT control testing and assessments of control design and operating effectiveness, as well as remediation testing where applicable.
  • Maintain accurate and detailed control testing documentation of testing procedures, findings, and recommendations.
  • Maintain and update process narratives related to SOX IT areas that include logical access, change management, computer operations, and systems development lifecycle.
  • Perform an initial evaluation of SOC 1/ISAE 3402 reports and provide summarized results for review and approval.
  • Ensure that identified deficiencies or key observations are assessed for severity, remediated, and reported.
  • Contribute to the enhancement of the IT Compliance Framework Monitoring & Assessment program, documentation, processes, and procedures to drive up standards.
  • Assist in response to internal and external inspection requests and observations (CAPAs) where IT Compliance framework and/or 3rd Party monitoring/governance involvement may be required.
  • Assist in the development and implementation of effective tools and technology to support the function.
  • Build positive and collaborative business relationships with stakeholders to support effective and efficient management of the SOX-IT program.
  • Maintain awareness of the Culture of Excellence across BMS.


Requirements:

  • Apply knowledge of IT General Controls (ITGCs) in the design, assessment, implementation, and monitoring of IT controls.
  • Apply knowledge of IT SOX, ICFR, COSO, and baseline understanding of business process controls.
  • Experience in performing IT SOX testing, including ITGCs, and Report Testing.
  • Bachelor's in Information Technology, Quality or Science or equivalent experience.
  • Industry experience: 2 to 4 years of experience in IT and/or Quality Assurance preferably based at a bio/pharmaceutical company.
  • Ability to use Microsoft Excel to execute and document SOX IT testing procedures (i. e. knowledge of Excel formulas, pivot tables, etc. )
  • Possesses strong organizational skills to manage a large volume of testing requests and provide accurate status reporting.
  • Demonstrates openness to learning and developing. Takes a responsibility for their own development and growth.
  • Explain your own work clearly and confidently.
  • Demonstrates awareness of functional business context and the impact on their own work.
  • Collects and reviews data sources to provide a sound recommendation. Identified basic implications from a logical analysis of a routine situation or issue. Determines the most appropriate solution
  • Demonstrates an understanding of factors driving team performance and how they contribute to the team's overall success.
  • Develops an understanding of other's views and builds rapport with stakeholders.
  • Openly considers new ways and solutions to enhance their own work and offers new ideas/continuous improvement

  • Financial Statements:
  • Prepare and review financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements. Analyze financial data to identify trends, variances, and key performance indicators. Provide insights to management for strategic decision-making.

  • Establish and maintain effective financial controls to safeguard company assets and ensure compliance with internal policies and procedures. Monitor and assess the effectiveness of internal controls and make recommendations for improvements, as necessary.

  • Process Improvement:
  • Continuously evaluate and improve financial reporting processes, streamline workflows, and implement best practices. Identify opportunities to automate and enhance reporting capabilities using financial systems and tools.

We build plugins/templates for features that are common across platforms., You'll need to keep an eye out for such opportunities, and may even be involved in building them.

details.description:
As the People Systems Manager - HCM, you will play a crucial role in driving the successful adoption and implementation of our HCM software and people technology solutions. This role is for someone who isn't afraid to wear multiple hats and believes a company's greatest asset is its people.

Your primary focus will be to lead the execution of operational human capital management activities, including offering HCM strategies that align with functional and business objectives, providing HCM administration and support, and owning the roadmap for ongoing enhancements & release management. The right person for this role enjoys creating people-first experiences, loves solving problems, is curious about new technology, and is someone who seeks to make a difference and celebrate with their team. This role reports to the Sr. Manager, of People Systems, and will work closely with all members of our global People (Human Resources) team alongside many members of thee extended global Cornerstone family.


Responsibilities:

  • Drive adoption, optimization, and utilization of our HCM technology and solutions
  • Collaborate with the People team and leaders to develop customized HCM strategies that align with their business goals and leverage our software and People technology effectively.
  • Continuously evaluate and identify efficiencies, and initiate programs to enhance system services, processes, and offerings to meet organizational goals and data needs.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally to support cohesive people process improvements and effectiveness
  • Implement change management initiatives related to our software technology solutions and processes, ensuring a smooth transition and user adoption
  • Provide training sessions and ongoing up-skilling support to the People team and end-users, equipping them with the knowledge to use our products efficiently.
  • Serve as the primary point of contact for employee inquiries, issues, and escalations, providing exceptional customer service and timely resolution, including testing and troubleshooting as needed
  • Support daily operations and project manage key initiatives.
  • Keep up-to-date with industry best practices, trends, and advancements in HCM and learning technology
  • Attain and maintain product certification on Cornerstone products where necessary


Requirements:

  • Proven experience (5+ years) as an HCM Manager, HR Manager, or in a similar client-facing role in the HCM Technology industry
  • Experience with leading at least 1 full life cycle HCM implementation with experience covering requirement development and definition, functional solution design, implementation, data migration, system testing, user acceptance testing, and go-live.
  • Functional expertise in various HCM modules
  • In-depth knowledge of HCM principles, talent management strategies, and HR technology/service platforms ( e. g. ServiceNow, Cornerstone. etc. )
  • Strong Computer skills (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
  • Competence to grasp complex system workflows, to understand cause and effect for actions taken in a business process or software system
  • The skill to present, train, and educate small to large groups, in person or via Teams/Slack
  • A learning mindset continued curiosity to learn new systems and technical skills to support personal goals and development
  • Demonstrated ability to keep confidence and act with integrity to uphold high standards with regard to data and personnel matters
  • Obsessive attention to detail and organizational skills with a high level of accuracy
  • Ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines, and maintain creative problem-solving skills
  • Possess strong interpersonal and intercultural skills, acting as the consummate team player
  • Self-starter, the ability to work independently, manage multiple projects, and prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment
  • Consideration for privacy and security obligations
  • Demonstrated commitment to valuing diversity and contributing to an inclusive working and learning environment

details.description:
Cornerstone is looking for an experienced Senior Product Manager to join our Product team to help drive innovation that will delight our customers. We are looking for someone who will relentlessly pursue an understanding of our customers' pain points and partner with product development to drive new product solutions that drive customer value and ROI. In this role, you will translate ideas into a strategy that leads to new features and will follow product development from start to finish.


In this role, you would be a key member of the product team responsible for delivering solutions that improve a flagship product while innovating for the future. This role will collaborate closely with sales, customer success, design, marketing, and other cross-functional teams to support the execution of our product roadmap and product go-to-market strategy. This role sits within a global organization, and you will be required to work with a global team.


Responsibilities:

  • Own product requirements definition from conception to launch
  • Present product initiatives and vision to customers, prospects, and industry analysts

  • Code Quality and Testing: Write clean, well-documented, and maintainable code. Conduct thorough testing, including unit, integration, and end-to-end testing, to ensure software quality and reliability.

  • Collaboration: Work closely with product managers, UI/UX designers, and other developers to understand requirements, provide technical insights, and deliver high-quality solutions.

  • Research and Learning: Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends, emerging technologies, and development practices, and apply this knowledge to continuously enhance the development process.

Requirements:

  • Strong proficiency in C# and. NET frameworks (ASP. NET, ASP. NET Core).

details.description:
As a member of an innovative team of IT professionals, you will work closely with talented engineers and product owners across the globe to build and deploy enterprise applications that are used to run our business internally at Pega. The IT QA team plays an important role in helping Pega to grow by partnering with the business to roll out high-quality, scalable, enterprise applications for internal teams (Finance, Legal, Sales, Marketing, Consulting, HR, Order Management, IT), external stakeholders, clients, and partners. We strive for excellence and embrace agile methodologies to achieve it.


The Quality Assurance Engineer will be a member of the IT QA teams. You will provide testing services for the SAP Center of Excellence SCRUM team in one of Pegasystems' internal departments. You will be responsible for creating test plans, test cases, regression test suites, creating automated tests, and taking ownership of the overall quality of the products. You will also work collaboratively with the QA lead, technical lead, software engineers, product owners, and business users to develop quality applications.


Responsibilities:

  • Own the testing of newly implemented SAP features and drive the quality of our SAP implementation.
  • Work closely with the Finance team to ensure quality in the revenue recognition and financial reporting processes.
  • Participate in sprint grooming, test planning, product reviews, and other ad hoc meetings.
  • Responsible for converting requirements into Test Design, Test Cases and Test Execution for the product new features.
  • Create and execute test plans and provide feedback on the overall quality of the application.
  • Perform manual and automated test execution for new product features with complete test coverage.
  • Work collaboratively with the SCRUM team to drive the quality of the application through all phases of the project.
  • Work with the automation team to provide inputs for automated test creation.
  • Maintain and monitor automated tests and executions using TOSCA and create automated scripts for new features.


Requirements:

  • You are a BE/BTech graduate in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering.
  • You have 3-5 years of Software Quality Assurance Testing Experience in SAP - both manual and/or automated testing
  • You have a strong desire for product quality and the ability to coordinate with multiple teams to achieve results.
  • You have at least 4 years of experience in SAP testing (ECC 6.0 FI/CO/RAR/Assets/Consolidation/Controlling Configuration, Setup, SAP Business Process, SD/MM, BPC, SAP BW Hana)
  • You have knowledge of Finance Business Processes, project life cycle, and SAP OSS Functional Notes
  • You have knowledge of SAP support for Security audits and certifications, roles, and access.
  • You have knowledge of SAP landscapes, transport paths, migrations, and update processes.
  • You have knowledge of Finance and Accounting, Revenue Accounting and reporting, Sales Order and Material Management concepts and the ability to apply procedures, regulations, and policies related to these concepts.
  • You have the ability to operate with minimal supervision.
  • You have good oral and written communication skills with a strong desire for product quality and the ability to coordinate with multiple teams to achieve results.
  • You have the ability to work effectively with the SAP QA Lead and SAP Functional owners.
  • 3+ years of experience in Quality assurance in SAP.
  • Experience in manual and/or automated testing.
  • Experience participating in 2 or more full life-cycle implementation and upgrade projects.
  • Experience with FI/CO is required, and experience with RAR, MM, and SD is desirable.
  • Experience in SAP S/4HANA is a plus.
  • Experience with Thomson Reuters Tax Engines
  • Experience with integration of applications with SAP using different technologies/products; effective knowledge/use of web services
  • SAP FICO, RAR, SD, MM Certification preferred
  • Experience in converting requirements into Test Design, Test Cases and Test Execution for the product's new features
  • Experience in working with Scrum teams and following agile methodology in Software testing.
  • Excellent technical troubleshooting skills
  • Demonstrated ability to take initiative and display adaptability

details.description:
As the Lead Data Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in our organization's data management, business intelligence, and analytics efforts. You'll be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines, databases, BI solutions, and applying machine learning to enable data-driven decision-making across the company.


Responsibilities:

  • Data Engineering:
  • Design and implement robust ETL data pipelines from diverse sources into a central data warehouse.
  • Ensure data quality, accuracy, and consistency.
  • Optimize data storage and retrieval for performance and scalability.
  • Business Intelligence (BI):
  • Lead BI solutions development, creating interactive dashboards, reports, and data visualizations with Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and understand business requirements.
  • Ensure user-friendly BI solutions are accessible to non-technical users.
  • Data Analytics:
  • Apply data analysis techniques to uncover patterns, trends, and anomalies.
  • Create informative, visually appealing data visualizations for effective communication.
  • Statistical Modeling and Machine Learning:
  • Build predictive and descriptive models using machine learning techniques.
  • Utilize statistical modeling for in-depth analysis and forecasting.
  • Change Data Capture (CDC):
  • Implement CDC mechanisms for real-time data tracking and capture.
  • Keep data pipelines up-to-date with source data changes.
  • Team Leadership:
  • Provide technical guidance and mentorship to a data engineering and BI team.
  • Effectively manage project timelines and resources.
  • Cultivate a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.


Requirements:

  • This role requires a seasoned Lead Data Engineer with a strong technical skill set to manage data, BI, and machine learning projects while ensuring data quality, security, and efficiency throughout the process.
  • 6-8 years of experience, with a minimum of 4 years in data engineering and BI.
  • Strong working knowledge of ETL frameworks is required.
  • Data pipeline orchestration experience, including proficiency in Azure Data Factory (ADF) or similar ETL/ELT tools.
  • Strong cloud platform expertise, particularly in Azure Data Factory and AWS Glue.
  • Strong SQL proficiency is a must
  • Data transformation skills, including data mapping, and cleansing.
  • Working knowledge in Power BI, Tableau, or similar is required.
  • Data visualization proficiency using tools like Matplotlib, Seaborn, and BI platforms.
  • Monitoring and error handling in data pipelines, including troubleshooting.
  • Version control system familiarity (e. g., Git) for code management.
  • Optimization of data pipelines for performance and scalability.
  • Data pipeline security best practices and compliance with data privacy regulations.
details.title: Lead Data Engineer

details.description:
The person will work on Enterprise Data Quality tools used across the enterprise. This role is critical to enhance the adoption of tool usage in line with the defined service model across different functions in BMS.


Responsibilities:

  • Keeping the data quality platform (including dev, test and production environments) during business hours.
  • Ensuring the required activities are complete according to the Enterprise Data Quality and Issue Remediation standards.


Requirements:

  • Strong hands-on experience required with on-premises as well as Cloud DQ software support.
  • Knowledge of DAMA, DCAM, and ALCOA principles is preferred.
  • Hands-on experience in ServiceNow Request Processing, data quality management, data profiling, data and quality tools.
  • Ability to code programs using SQL and/or Python.
  • Setup and Maintain Data Quality Environment and software
  • Perform data quality software upgrades
  • Perform DQ system expansion, or increase processing power
  • Routinely Analyze and Assess Health of the DQ platform
  • Provide technical recommendation to support data verification needs
  • Work collaboratively with platform managers and comply with Enterprise Data Platform Standards, Procedures and Policies.
  • Create and maintain detailed work instructions for data quality platform and related software upgrades.
  • Actively comply with standard data architecture.
  • 2 to 4 years of experience in Life Sciences or similar industry supporting data platforms, DQ verification platforms, data quality operational dashboards, and issues management.
  • 2 to 4 of experience in data management, data analysis, data ingestion, and working with non-technical stakeholders.
  • 2 to 4 years of experience with Cloud data environments, Informatica Data quality (IDQ) or other DQ tools / platforms.
  • 2 to 4 years of experience with SQL, Python, and Tableau tools.
  • Experience in application development lifecycle. Experience with implementation or migration of data for enterprise-wide systems.
  • Strong critical thinking to analyse complex situations and discern critical issues.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills in English.
  • Ability to effectively produce her/his work independently from high-level directions.
  • Demonstrate the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts, multi-task, and act on decisions with quality work and limited risk.
  • Able to work effectively in highly matrixed and multi-cultural workforce and build strong relationships by being transparent, reliable, and delivering on commitments.
  • Excellent team player attitude.
  • Able to manage competing priorities.

details.description:
As Scrum Master, you play a key role in the definition, development, implementation, and ongoing improvement of Agile practices (with an emphasis on Scrum) within the organization. You will facilitate sprint planning, retrospective, and daily activities related to stand-ups and sprint burn down; as well as maintain relevant metrics that help the team see and understand their progress during a sprint. In this role you'll own and resolve identified impediments. As Scrum Master you're responsible for leading the continual Agile transformation and practices as well as promoting accountability and transparency across all levels of the organization.


Responsibilities:

  • Perform the role of scrum master for one or more teams, leading multiple, simultaneous initiatives or medium complexity programs/release.
  • Practices the core Agile principles of collaboration, prioritisation, accountability, and practices continuous improvement.
  • Facilitates sprint demos, planning, and retrospectives
  • Tracks and communicates team velocity and sprint/release progress
  • Provide status reporting on key performance indicators (KPIs), schedule, resources, and milestone delivery


Requirements:

  • Strong agile practice skills/background (XP, Safe, Scrum, POD)
  • Effective leadership of scrum team(s)
  • Coaching of backlog ceremonies and definition of ready adherence
  • Orchestrate solution demos to incremental value showcase.
  • Demonstrated effective coaching.
  • Demonstrated effective crucial conversation skills.
  • Coach pairing sessions focused on story refinement.
  • Skilled in Gherkin (Given, When Then) style acceptance criteria
  • Certification preferred for senior positions.
  • Bachelor's Degree/equivalent in computer science, engineering, or information systems and/or equivalent formal training or work experience.
  • Requires two (2) years qualifying work experience in information technology or engineering environment.
  • A related advanced degree may offset the related experience requirements.
details.title: Scrum Master

details.description:
Responsibilities:

  • Brainstorm on product requirements, technical design, and solution architecture.
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders and product managers.
  • Creative problem solving and rapid prototyping to devise solution ideas and strategies.
  • Design data models, data flows, API specifications, architectural patterns.
  • Code contributor on our bleeding-edge tech stack: Java, Spring, Spring Cloud, Microservices, Netflix OSS, Docker, Kubernetes.
  • Deliver well designed, efficient, and testable code.
  • Deploy to Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
  • Performance engineering, security engineering, release management, build and test automation


Requirements:

  • 3+ years hands-on industry experience in Enterprise Java.
  • Strong foundations in computer science, data structures, algorithms, and programming logic.
  • Strong foundations in core Java: Collections, Multi-threading, Concurrency, and Synchronization concepts.
  • Strong understanding of object oriented programming, MVC frameworks, design patterns, and multi-tiered application architecture.
  • Hands-on experience in Spring, JDBC, JPA, Hibernate, XML Parsers, Regular Expressions.
  • Experience building RESTful Web Services and a strong understanding of the Web Stack: Protocols, HTTP, JSON, XML, AJAX, Web Security.
  • Knowledge of relational databases (MySQL / PostgreSQL / MSSQL) and NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Cassandra, CouchDB).
  • Experience in deploying to Java application servers.
  • Experience with Microservices, Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, Netflix OSS, and any Cloud Platform (AWS, Azure, or GCP) would be an added advantage.
  • Experience in the full Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies.
  • DevOps mindset with a working experience of CI/CD, Build Automation Tools, Git, Maven, Automated Unit Testing, Linux foundations would be an added advantage.
